hadithText: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah forbade celibacy.

"The superiority of 'Aishah to other women is like the superiority of Tharid to other kinds of food."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText:
Sauda bint Zam`a gave up her turn to me (`Aisha), and so the Prophet used to give me (`Aisha) both 
my day and the day of Sauda.
that when Saudah bint Zam'ah grew old, she gave her day to 'Aishah, and the Messenger of Allah went to 'Aishah on Saudah's day.

Sauda (RA) daughter of Zam'ah gave away her day to 'Aishah (RA). So the Prophet (SAW) allotted a share to 'Aishah (RA) of her day and Sauda's.

[Agreed upon].
Hammam narrated the hadith from A'isha like the (above-mentioned) traditions.

hadithNarrated: And in the narration of al-Bukhari narrated by 'Aishah (RA) is:

hadithText: Ibn Hibban also reported something similar from 'Aishah (RA).
'A'isha reported that people sent their gifts when it was the turn of 'A'isha seeking thereby the pleasure of Allah's Messenger (may peace be upon him).

The people used to look forward for the days of my (`Aisha's) turn to send gifts to Allah's Apostle in 
order to please him.
It was narrated that 'Aishah, may Allah be pleased with her, said: "The Messenger of Allah gave his wives the choice (of staying with him) was it divorce?"
It was narrated that 'Aishah said: "The Messenger of Allah did not die until Allah permitted him to marry whatever women he wanted."
"The people used to try to bring their gifts (to the Prophet) on 'Aishah's day, hoping thereby to earn the pleasure of the Messenger of Allah."
"The Messenger of Allah said: 'O 'Aishah, this is Jibril and he is sending greetings of Salam to you.'" The same.
“I never looked at or I never saw the private part of the Messenger of Allah.' ”
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from a freed slave of 'Aishah that 'Aishah said:

hadithText: 'A'isha a family which has no dates (in their house) its members will be hungry; (or) 'A'isha the family which has no dates its members may be hungry. He said this twice or thrice.
hadithNarrated: 'A'isha reported Allah's Messenger (may peace be upon him) as saying:

hadithText:
`Aisha said that the Prophet said to her "O `Aisha' This is Gabriel and he sends his (greetings) 
salutations to you." `Aisha said, "Salutations (Greetings) to him, and Allah's Mercy and Blessings be 
on him," and addressing the Prophet she said, "You see what I don't see."

(the wife the Prophet) Allah's Apostle said, "O Aisha! This is Gabriel sending his greetings to you." I 
said, "Peace, and Allah's Mercy be on him." `Aisha added: The Prophet used to see things which we 
used not to see.
"The Prophet (SAW) wanted to wipe the running nose of Usamah." 'Aishah said: "Leave it to me so that I may be the one to do it." He said: "O 'Aishah, love him, for verily I love him."
hadithNarrated: Narrated 'Aishah, the Mother of the Believers:

hadithText: Dhakwan, the client of Aisha, reported on the authority of Aisha: The Messenger of Allah (saws) used to pray after the afternoon prayer but prohibited others from it; and he would fast continuously but forbid others to do so.

'Aishah said: "I never looked at (or I never saw) the private part of the Messenger of Allah." (Da'if)(One of the narrators) Abu Bakr (Ibn Abu Shaibah) said: "Abu Nu'aim would say: '(From) a freed female slave of 'Aishah.'"
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from a freed slave of 'Aishah that:
